intro: Amethystanthus effusus var. leucanthus, commonly known as the white amethyst flower, is a striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its clusters of showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often with a slight lavender hue. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to cultivated environments.
